snippet.textDisplay: @mrguy22494 Because, again, it is a different game from Rondo of Blood. The real title of the game is Akumajou: Dracula XX.
snippet.textOriginal: @mrguy22494 Because, again, it is a different game from Rondo of Blood. The real title of the game is Akumajou: Dracula XX.

snippet.textDisplay: @Hayao Dracula X plays like a different game compared to the original Rondo of Blood. It plays a lot like Castlevania III for some reason.
snippet.textOriginal: @Hayao Dracula X plays like a different game compared to the original Rondo of Blood. It plays a lot like Castlevania III for some reason.

snippet.textDisplay: @mrguy22494 ...Rondo of Blood IS Dracula X. What you're listening to here is the version from Dracula XX, the Super Famicom sequel to Rondo of Blood. It isn't a port, like the crappy Western localization would lead you to believe.
snippet.textOriginal: @mrguy22494 ...Rondo of Blood IS Dracula X. What you're listening to here is the version from Dracula XX, the Super Famicom sequel to Rondo of Blood. It isn't a port, like the crappy Western localization would lead you to believe.

snippet.textDisplay:
Engine kicks ass anyway)It's CDmdl2,after all.
P.S I admire Genesis music more than Snes,because Snes has that Sony sound chip which could use real music samples-that's why it sounded like real instruments. Sega Genesis has that crappy 8-bit yamaha sound sythesizer which can produce only noise!Still the programmers tried to use it as best as they could. And there are some masterpieces for Sega.
snippet.textOriginal:
Engine kicks ass anyway)It's CDmdl2,after all.
P.S I admire Genesis music more than Snes,because Snes has that Sony sound chip which could use real music samples-that's why it sounded like real instruments. snippet.textDisplay: I'm not sure what bothers me about this one...it almost feels like some of the "flute" notes before the trumpet chorus get cut off by each succeeding note. At any rate, I like the PCE one just a little more, even if this version is very good.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm not sure what bothers me about this one...it almost feels like some of the "flute" notes before the trumpet chorus get cut off by each succeeding note. At any rate, I like the PCE one just a little more, even if this version is very good.
